ratings.rComments: This is a very fast paced course, and between lectures, labs, and homework, it can be difficult to keep up. Reviewing the lecture notes after class and seeing what you might have missed out in lecture will definitely go a long way to helping someone get a good grade in the class.

Do the homework and prelectures and everything else and you'll have a pretty good buffer for the midterm and final. STUDY YOUR ASS OFF FOR THE EXAMS THEY COUNT FOR A LOT. Kwiat is a awesome though, he gives candy for participation.

He's an amazing lecturer and really cares about teaching Phys 213 and 214. While some lectures are a little dry, its mainly because of the content, not because of him. He does a lot of demos which are really nice.
Amazing professor. Quite possibly the best one I've had at UIUC. He really knows his stuff AND is incredible at teaching. 1010 would take another class with him
stylish bowtie and suspenders

He was a very nice man but I did not think he was very good at teaching. He's brilliant but lecture was so confusing and he went so quickly. Questions were not answered as thoroughly during lecture but his office hours were good. An incredibly hard class but he tried to make it understandable, it just was not as helpful.
Easy to understand and good at explaining things. Lectures contained lots of experimental work that I didn't care about, making the class a bit less rigorous than I expected.

Just your average professor. Goes over the material incredibly fast. Students think he's an exceptional professor, but I'm forced to think otherwise. He's very talented, though. He answers questions well and awards candy if you answer a question correctly during class.

Great demonstrations in class but the problems are difficult to get started. He's a fun lecturer but the material can by difficult to grasp. This class will be especially hard for those that tested out of E&M.
Fun demonstrations in class but the material is tough. Exams aren't much easier than the homework.
Demonstrations in class are fun and the lectures can be very entertaining even if you don't know anything about quantum physics. The class is also really hard. Each problem is a challenge.
This is one of the tougher classes on campus. Each problem feel unique, making the material difficult to learn.
Very easy class, Easily got an A+.
kwiat is overrated. People only like him b.Ecause he wears a bow tie a.Nd suspenders but he. Isn't a very good professor. S

He's a great guy and I sort of fell in love with him. He obviously knows the material and is quite enthusiastic about it. But sadly, he doesn't teach very well. Although I found his teaching to be average, I would still recommend him. Quantum is sort of mind boggling sometimes. The Yale OCW videos on Quantum Physics saved my grade in the course.
Wonderful prof. he knows his material well, and he is extremely helpful.
What an awesome guy! Lectures have a lot of cool demos and are worth going to.

Kwiat is totally kooky but it makes an otherwise boring class (in my opinion) somewhat enjoyable. He lectures pretty fast but somehow the fact that he always wears suspenders and a bow tie makes me absorb the material better. I would highly recommend him.
He is such a foxxxxx!

He is perhaps the best physics professor on this campus. He both knows the material AND knows how to teach. This is super rare in the physics department. If you have to do physics here and he is one of the professors for your class, take his section.

Excellent lecturer. He's very nerdy and enthusiastic about physics. Can be spotted swing dancing and ice skating outside of class. Homework and labs aren't bad. I had issues with the exams but it wasn't a deal breaker.
Kwiat is the MAN! He is amazing. and that's that.

Everyone likes Kwiat, except for me. This guy is too smart for what he is teaching. He goes way too fast, he flashes his little science experiments, which btw don't do a thing for helping you do well on the difficult exams, and in general goes over your head. Not only that, but he is arrogant when people ask him questions. Get someone more normal.

I had Kwiat for 213 and 214. Although he is a good professor and very enthusiastic some of the material was over my head. I know a lot of people got As on the exams but I averaged about a C-. Homework and labs definitly bump up you grade however.
He's very enthusiastic about teaching. Exams are fair and lectures are interesting. He also holds review sessions for the midterms and final.
Good professor. Attend lectures as the notes need an explanation to make sense. Very smart and a funny guy.
I hated the class because I had no interest in it but Professor Kwiat was very good.  He was very clear in lecture, always replied to emails, and was helpful too.  His lectures were fun to go to too.

Although he's extremely enthusiastic, I feel his teaching abilities are a little overexaggerated. OK professor, however 212 exams were extremely difficult and hardly resembled the practice exams (even in difficulty).  Cool demos in class, but may talk a little quick and write messily on the board.
awesome

He is a good speaker/lecturer, and obviously loves teaching, but (particularly in 213) sometimes seemed to not really know what he was talking about, and often didn't go over the basic points enough, making the advanced stuff harder.  He taught 214 better than 213, in general.

He loves what he does and transfers that enthusiasm to his students, even in a large lecture setting.  Plenty of useful demonstrations in class.  Most of the material covered in the lecture is read straight off of the course notes, so if you miss a lecture, it is easy to catch up.
Kwiat rocked my socks off. Very entertaining and effective. Inspired me to attend some lectures.

Great professor, makes class interesting, one of those professors that wear a red bow tie to class. A very memorable professor. He went to MIT and he's young too, so he's current with all the physics stuff. A little inncentric.
Physics 112 is a really really hard class, but Professor Kwiat is a good teacher in a tough subject. Study a lot. Plus you gotta love his bow-ties. The swing dancing professor!
Although the ratings seem low, it is because the class is hard, not the professor.  Kwiat is a great person, but does seem to be a bit condescending at times.
Good lecturer and cool demos, so go to class!
Great lecturer and very friendly professor. Made physics lecture worth going to.
Very good explanations of pretty complicated problems.  Very helpful in class and has plenty of out of class problem sessions to help prepare for exams and such.
Kind of reminds me of Bill Nye. Decent explanations on hard material, quite friendly, and shows crazy video clips while we take a break.
nice bow tie!
he needs a pair of clown shoes
No Comments
